required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Macitentan in Subjects With Combined Pre- and Post-capillary Pulmonary Hypertension (CpcPH) Due to Left Ventricular Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, 12-week Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Macitentan in Subjects With Combined Pre- and Post-capillary Pulmonary Hypertension (CpcPH) Due to Left Ventricular Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock: Study to evaluate if macitentan is safe and tolerable enough to be used for treatment of subjects with combined pre- and post-capillary pulmonary hypertension (CpcPH) due to left ventricular dysfunction.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Significant Fluid Retention or Worsening in NYHA Functional Class (FC) up to End-of-treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to End-of-Study (Week 12 + 30 days follow-up) plus 1 calendar day
primary_outcome.description: The main endpoint is the number of participants who had at least one of the following: A) significant fluid retention, defined as increase in body weight at any time by ≥ 5% or ≥ 5 kg from baseline due to fluid overload and/or parenteral administration of diuretics. B) Worsening of NYHA functional class from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: NT-proBNP at Week 12 Expressed as Percent of Baseline NT-proBNP at Rest
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to end of treatment period (Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: PVR at Rest at Week 12 Expressed as Percent of Baseline PVR at Rest
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to end of treatment period (Week 12)
secondary_outcome.description: Pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) was assessed at rest by right heart catheterization (RHC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Mean Pulmonary Arterial Pressure (mPAP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to end of treatment period (Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Mean Right Atrial Pressure (mRAP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to end of treatment period (Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Pulmonary Artery Wedge Pressure (PAWP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to end of treatment period (Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Cardiac Index (CI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to end of treatment period (Week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Diastolic Pulmonary Vascular Pressure Gradient (DPG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to end of treatment period (Week 12)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Males and Females >=18 years of age
2. Subjects with combined pre-and post-capillary Pulmonary Hypertension (CpcPH) due to left ventricular dysfunction (subset of WHO groups 2.1 and 2.2)
3. Optimized diuretic therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Types of Pulmonary Hypertension other than WHO groups 2.1 and 2.2 (Nice classification)
2. Administration of PAH-specific therapy (i.e., Endothelin receptor antagonists (ERAs), Prostanoids, Phosphodiesterase 5 (PDE-5) inhibitors, guanylate cyclase stimulators)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were screened from 28 sites across Europe and North America in 11 countries (Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Germany, France, Israel, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, USA).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 88 participants screened 63 were randomized in a 1:1 ratio to macitentan 10 mg (N = 31) or placebo (N = 32).

measure.title: Age
Age, Customized
Sex: Female, Male
Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Time from Left Ventricular Dysfunction (LVD) diagnosis
Time from Combined pre- and post-capillary Pulmonary Hypertension (CpcPH) diagnosis
measure.population: The value of 1 patient is missing in the macitentan group.

measure.title: New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Class at baseline
measure.description: Class I: No symptoms and no limitation in ordinary physical activity, e.g., shortness of breath when walking, climbing stairs etc. Class II: Mild symptoms (mild shortness of breath and/or angina) and slight limitation during ordinary activity. Class III: Marked limitation in activity due to symptoms, even during less-than ordinary activity, e.g., walking short distances (20–100 m). Comfortable only at rest. Class IV: Severe limitations. Experiences symptoms even while at rest. Mostly bedbound patients.

measure.title: 6-minute walk distance (6MWD) at baseline
Participants with Atrial Fibrillation at baseline
Participants with Diabetes Mellitus Type II
Participants with Right Heart Failure (RHF)
Participants with Systemic Hypertension
Participants with Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD)
Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LEVF) at baseline as measured by Investigator
Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR) at baseline
Body Mass Index (BMI) at baseline
Participants with obesity (BMI > 30 kg/m^2)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any study-related publication written independently by investigators must be submitted to Actelion for review at least 30 days prior to submission for publication or presentation. Upon review, Actelion may provide comments, and may also request alterations and/or deletions for the sole purpose of protecting its confidential information and/or patent rights.
